page.title: 06Frocester Court and Barn.
page.content: Frocester Court and its surrounding land form an ancient and historic area with evidence of settlements & farming from the Iron Age and Roman Periods. Today the owner of the Court has a great interest in the past and has given his spare time to researching the past. He has excavated sites on the farm and collected artefacts found in Archaeological Digs or in walking fields after ploughing.We saw maps of the changes in house sites and farming patterns and notes on each house which show that Frocester once had several trades and shops within the village. The Court was bought by its present owner in 1970 & he is the first owner to live in the house for over 200 yrs. The present stone house,built between 1450 & 1550 was erected around an earlier timber frame house.
